data.description: Grants the legal right to begin physical construction of the BESS facility. Requires prior environmental clearance and approved site and structural plans.

notes.informal_notes: Delays arise from ambiguity in drawings, absence of standard templates for BESS structures, and occasional political interference.
notes.symbolic_scaffold: The construction permit marks a highly visible transition point — moving from planning to physical presence. Local governments often signal development alignment here.
notes.feedback_structure: PUPR may request adjustments but rarely provides proactive guidance. Informal broker mediation common.
failure_modes: Permit suspended pending environmental document clarification
Misalignment between grid location and civil site plan
Intervention from local actors citing nuisance or zoning objections
